content.description: Crux is low, so best to stick clip.   Anchors are up on the easy terrain just out of sight.   Joi swears this route is no more than 10c, the rest of us think she is nuts.   Named after Joi "Radio" who is always broadcasting.  First route encountered from the approach trail (its the furthest right/lowest route at the Mini Max, the rest are uphill to the left).
content.protection: 4 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: Furthest right right at the Mini Max, and the first route encountered from the approach trail.  Just left of a blunt arete where the wall curves around to right to become the Maple Haven sector.

content.description: Start with a high stick clip above a low roof.   Climb up the easy ledges to the roof, pull up and over, and enjoy easier terrain to the chains.
content.protection: 6 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners

content.description: Starts on easy ground which leads to a small roof / bulge.  Skirt the right side of the roof.   This is one of the more enjoyable routes on the wall.  The crux may seem a little hard for this grade, but feel around and there are some pretty good holds that make it reasonable.
content.protection: 8 Stainless Bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: 3rd route from the right.  Starts on an easy ramp just right of a low roof.

content.description: A little tricky low, then eases up at the top.
content.protection: 5 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: 2nd route from the right.  Starts above a leveled out belay spot as you just begin to walk up the hill.

content.description: Pulls the low bulge to mildly overhanging terrain.  Unless you are very comfortable at this grade, its best to stick clip the first 2 bolts.   We had trouble optimizing the bolt placements in the rock on this one, so the 2nd bolt might be hard for leaders at this grade to clip.
content.protection: 7 Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: Furthest left route as you work your way up the Mini Max wall.   Just past this are the stairs and rung climb which leads to the Maximum.
